clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Cognitive Stimulation in Older People With Mild Cognitive Impairment
clinical_study.official_title: Effectiveness of a Cognitive Stimulation Program on Anxiety, Depression and Quality of Life in People Older Than 70 Years With Mild Cognitive Impairment.

brief_summary.textblock: Mild cognitive impairment is becoming one of the most common cynical manifestations that affect older people. That is why there is a need to investigate non-pharmacological interventions that help to improve or maintain this problem.

detailed_description.textblock: Each week for 8 weeks, GE participants will attend three 60-minute sessions of cognitive exercises. Each session is divided into 10 minutes of memory practice, which includes short-term and long-term memory; 10 minutes of language skills, including vocabulary, comprehension, reading and writing exercises; 10 minutes of calculation, in which arithmetic, similar and different operations are carried out; 10 minutes of praxis and gnosis where drawing and recognition and auditory, tactile, spatial, visual attention were promoted; 10 minutes of orientation where knowledge of space, person and place is developed; and 10 minutes of executive functions in which exercises of organization, planning and problem solving are worked.

primary_outcome.description: A tool that can be used to systematically and thoroughly assess mental status.

arm_group.description: This group receives physical training based on exercises for cognitive stimulation.
This group does not receive any treatment.

intervention.description: Each week for 8 weeks, GE participants attend three 60-minute sessions of cognitive exercises.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- With or without dependency to move.
- People who show mild cognitive impairment.
- That they were able to carry out the different selected questionnaires.
Exclusion Criteria:
- People with visual deficit.
- People already enrolled in a cognitive program.
- Score between 24 and 10 in the Mini Cognitive Exam (MEC).
